subject: Re: tests do not run after adding another suite to AllTests
msgSnippet: David, Thanks for getting back to me. I was hoping I was doing something idiotically silly and would be obvious to others. Alas... Yes, I am using ant under
messageBody:
David,

Thanks for getting back to me. I was hoping I was doing something
idiotically silly and would be obvious to others. Alas...

Yes, I am using ant under cygwin on windows xp. I have not tried
running from command line, nor from within Eclipse, which obviously
implies not running from a debugger. I am not sure how I would do that
in Eclipse, to tell you the truth. I have never done this, but see my
junit recipes book discusses running tests from within eclipse. I'll
give that a try later today.

I did comment out the various AllTests and found the offender. That
AllTest only executed one test. So, I added a target for the one
offending test class. When running that, the response is the same as
below. It appears to be not running the test at all.

I am using the ant junit command. I doubt the problem is in the ant
script as there are several targets that do work, and even the one
AllTest works as long as I comment out the offending reference to
AllTest within that class.

I want this to work, of course, but I have to meet prod schedules so
I've tested in other ways.

I'll post a reply once I've tried your suggestions. In the meantime,
if you think of any other suggestions, I'd appreciate it.

Bill

--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "David Saff" <saff@...> wrote:
>
> Bill,
>
> On the face of it, there's nothing that seems obviously wrong, nor can I
> think of a common mistake that would lead to that behavior. There's a
> couple ways to drive debugging from here, in order:
>
> 1) It looks like you're using ant. Does either suite run from the
command
> line, or from within an IDE like Eclipse?
> 2) Can you run the suite in a debugger (say, in Eclipse)?
> 3) Can you "delta debug" by commenting out lines in the offending
suite, and
> drive down to a particular problem class?
> 4) What ant command are you using?
>
> Good luck,
>
> David Saff
>
> On 11/6/06, bill turner <bill.turner@...> wrote:
> >
> > Running Junit 3.8.
> >
> > I have an AllTests class that does not run after adding a new suite.
> > Here is the top level AllTest code:
> >
> > <snip>
> >
> > public static Test suite () throws Exception
> > {
> > TestSuite suite = new TestSuite("all powerpick tests");
> >
> > suite.addTest(com.rjmdental.powerpick.types.test.AllTests.suite());
> > suite.addTest(com.rjmdental.powerpick.input.test.AllTests.suite());
> > //
> > suite.addTest(com.rjmdental.powerpick.sequence.test.AllTests.suite());
> > return suite;
> > }
> >
> > </snip>
> >
> > When the last one is uncommented my run changes from:
> >
> > <snip>
> > test_powerpick:
> > [junit] Running com.rjmdental.powerpick.test.AllTests
> > [junit] Tests run: 58, Failures: 0, Errors: 0, Time elapsed:
0.25 sec
> > [junit] Testsuite: com.rjmdental.powerpick.test.AllTests
> > [junit] Tests run: 58, Failures: 0, Errors: 0, Time elapsed:
0.25 sec
> > .
> > .
> > .
> > </snip>
> >
> > to:
> >
> > <snip>
> > test_powerpick:
> > [junit] Running com.rjmdental.powerpick.test.AllTests
> > </snip>
> >
> > I have compared the "sequence" AllTest to the "input" AllTest and see
> > no significant difference. The sequence AllTest adds only one suite,
> > whereas input adds two. I've compared these class specific test
> > classes and again see no significant difference. Obviously, I am
> > missing something, but I do not know where to look. Any suggestions
> > would be greatly appreciated.
> >
> > TIA,
> >
> > bill turner
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> > Yahoo! Groups Links
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
>
>

>
